intro: Spilotantha xanthodactyla, commonly known as the yellow-fingered spilotantha, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. Spilotantha xanthodactyla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
